attributes.text:
The menu is a popup like control which supports buttons. It comes with full keyboard navigation and an improved timeout based pointer control behavior.

This class is the container for all derived instances of {@link qx.ui.menu.AbstractButton}.
shows a slidebar to easily navigate inside the menu (if too little space is left)
Updates the visibility of the slidebar based on the menu’s current size and position.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property arrowColumnWidth.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #arrowColumnWidth}.

Schedules the addition of the slidebar and calls the given callback after the slidebar has been added.
The return value of the callback if the slidebar already exists, or undefined if it doesn’t
Computes the size of the menu. This method is used by the {@link qx.ui.core.MPlacement} mixin.
Update position if the menu or the root is resized
Convenience method to add a separator to the menu

Opens the menu and configures the opener
Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.
Opens the menu in relation to the given point
Opens the menu at the pointer position

Resets the user value of the property arrowColumnWidth.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #arrowColumnWidth}.

Default arrow column width if no sub menus are rendered
Interval in ms after which sub menus should be closed
Default icon column width if no icons are rendered. This property is ignored as soon as an icon is present.
The currently opened button (sub menu is visible)
Interval in ms after which sub menus should be opened
The spacing between each cell of the menu buttons
